content.question:
<math alttext="C O, gas, plus 3 H 2, gas, establish equilibrium with C H 4, gas, plus H 2 O, gas. K sub p, equals 66 at 500 degrees Celsius." overflow="scroll"><mtext>C</mtext><mtext>O</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mtext>H</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>⇄</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mtext>H</mtext><mn>4</mn></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mtext>H</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="4.0em"></mspace><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>p</mi></msub><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>66</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext>at 500</mtext><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></math>

At a certain time, the partial pressure of the gases in the reaction mixture represented above had the values shown in the table below.

<math alttext="P sub C O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="P sub H 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="P sub C H 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="P sub H 2 O" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></math>

<math alttext="0.02 atmosphere" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>0.02</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>a</mtext><mtext>t</mtext><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></math>
<math alttext="1.0 atmosphere" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>a</mtext><mtext>t</mtext><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="0.4 atmosphere" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.4</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>a</mtext><mtext>t</mtext><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="0.4 atmosphere" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.4</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>a</mtext><mtext>t</mtext><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

Based on the information above, which of the following occurred as the reaction mixture moved toward equilibrium?

choices.label: More <math alttext="C H 4, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> was produced because the rate of the forward reaction was higher than the rate of the reverse reaction.

More <math alttext="H 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> was produced because the rate of the reverse reaction was higher than the rate of the forward reaction.

More <math alttext="C H 4, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> was produced because the total pressure of the <math alttext="H 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C O, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><mtext>O</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> combined was higher than that of the products; thus the reaction shifted to the side with the fewest number of moles of gas.

More <math alttext="H 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>H</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> was produced because the pressure of <math alttext="C O, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><mtext>O</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> was the least and the reaction shifted to the side with the smaller number of moles of gas.

content.answer: More <math alttext="C H 4, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> was produced because the rate of the forward reaction was higher than the rate of the reverse reaction.

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
